FuncDef:
The flow-interface-group command associates a BGP Flow Specification interface group with a BGP Flow Specification route.
The undo flow-interface-group command restores the default configuration.
By default, a BGP Flow Specification interface group is not associated with a BGP Flow Specification route.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a BGP Flow Specification interface group ID.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 16383.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Without a BGP Flow Specification interface group, the traffic filtering rules configured for BGP Flow Specification routes take effect globally, not on a specified interface. If a BGP Flow Specification interface group is configured, the traffic filtering rules configured for BGP Flow Specification routes also take effect on a specified interface. In this manner, traffic can be forwarded based on the rules of the BGP Flow Specification routes on the specified interface.
After a BGP Flow Specification interface group is created using the flow-interface-group command, you need to run the interface (BGP Flow Specification interface group view) command to add an interface to the group.
Between forwarders, the flow-interface-group command needs to be run in the Flow-Route view to associate a BGP Flow Specification interface group with a BGP Flow Specification route so that the traffic filtering rules configured for the route take effect on a specified interface.The command is not required between the controller and forwarders.

Prerequisites
A BGP Flow Specification route has been created and its view has been displayed using the flow-route command.
